title: Bug 50059: Resources are not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml
description: Bug 50059: Resources are not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml. Make a Servlet 3.0 web app (let's name it foo) with the metadatacomplete="true" attribute set on the webapp element in the /WEBINF/web.xml.
OB: When starting the web app in Tomcat 7.0.2 and accessing http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html in a browser, the expected result is a 200 response and index.html being served. However, the actual result is a 404 error. Modifying the web.xml to metadatacomplete="false" and restarting the app allows /foo/index.html to respond as expected. Testing the same web app with Glassfish v3.0.1 shows that it works as expected regardless of the metadatacomplete attribute.
EB: The expected behavior is that resources should be served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources even when the metadatacomplete attribute is set to "true" in the web.xml file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a Servlet 3.0 web app with the metadatacomplete="true" attribute in the webapp element of the /WEBINF/web.xml file.
2. Start the web app in Tomcat 7.0.2.
3. Access http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html in a browser.
4. Observe the 404 error instead of the expected 200 response and index.html being served.
